adamhooper commented on pull request #6460: ARROW-6895: [C++] handle dictionary deltas
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6460
 
 
   Previously, ByteArrayDictionaryRecordReader would clear the dictionary
   after returning a chunk. Now, it persists the dictionary in case a
   future chunk needs it.
   
   Sorry -- I feel I'm missing the expertise to write a unit test. But I can attest that in Arrow 0.16 the code snippet in ARROW-6895 segfaults on the `bad.parquet` attached to that issue; and after this patch, it works correctly.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++][Parquet] parquet::arrow::ColumnReader: ByteArrayDictionaryRecordReader repeats returned values when calling `NextBatch()`

comments.body: Thanks, I indeed see the issue. Your patch touches some things that are not related to the core problem so I'll write a new patch and add a unit test.
Was this never fixed? I must have gotten sidetracked. Leaving in 0.16.0

The code snippet given in the bug description still fails to read the {{bad.parquet}} file I uploaded.

Perhaps there were two bugs, and only one has been fixed? Please advise me whether I should leave this bug open (since the supplied code+file still aren't read properly) or open a new issue (since the GitHub patch does address the title of this bug).

By my reading, GitHub pull request #6206 did not add a test case for dictionary delta batches, like the one {{bad.parquet}} produces. The spec suggests the {{isDelta}} flag should prevent the dictionary from being cleared between column chunks: https://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/Columnar.html#dictionary-messages. So from my understanding, the reader should not be allowed to reset the dictionary builder until after it receives a dictionary batch for which {{isDelta == false}}.
I just uploaded {{01-fix-arrow-6895.diff}}, which I _imagine_ contains the final pieces needed to make my code snippet work on my uploaded file. I haven't submitted a unit test.
Thanks for the followup Adam, would you mind opening a PR for this, you'd get the credits for fixing it.
I'll see if I can add a unit test and merge this for 0.17.0
I'll try to add a test for this and close out the PR
